# HTML & CSS

## **Html** text :
### HTML has six "levels" of headings:
#### *<h1> is used for main headings,<h2> is used for subheadings ,If there are further sections under the subheadings then the <h3> element is used, and so on ..*

| Header | Header Tag                        |
|--------|-----------------------------------|
| H1     | <h1>This is a Main Heading</h1>   |
| H2     | <h2>This is a Level 2 Heading</h2>|
| H3     | <h3>This is a Level 4 Heading</h3>|
| H4     | <h4>This is a Level 4 Heading</h4>|
| H5     | <h5>This is a Level 4 Heading</h5>|
| H6     | <h6>This is a Level 4 Heading</h6>|



## **Paragraphs**:
### To create a paragraph, surround the words that make up the paragraph with an opening <p> tag and closing </p> tag.
![para](data:image/png;base64,)


## **Bold** & *Italic*:
### Bold : <b>, By enclosing words in the tags <b> and </b> we can make characters appear bold.
### Italic : <i>, By enclosing words in the tags <i> and </i> we can make characters appear italic.

## **CSS**:
### CSS allows you to create rules that control the way that each individual box (and the contents of that box) is presented.In this example, block level elements are shown with red borders, and inline elements have green borders. Using CSS, you could add a border around any of the boxes, specify its width and height, or add a background color. You could also control text inside a box â€” for example, its color, size, and the typeface used.

![css](https://quizlet.com/cdn-cgi/image/f=auto,fit=cover,h=200,onerror=redirect,w=240/https://o.quizlet.com/BAtk65bQjwQS33Xda0OdEg.png)

### CSS Properties Affect How Elements Are Displayed
### CSS declarations sit inside curly brackets and each is made up of two parts: a property and a value, separated by a colon. You can specify several properties in one declaration, each separated by a semi-colon.

### Using Internal CSS:
### <style> You can also include CSS rules within an HTML page by placing them inside a <style> element, which usually sits inside the <head> element of the page. The <style> element should use the type attribute to indicate that the styles are specified in CSS. The value should be text/css.

# **JavaScript**:

## COMMENTS:
### You should write comments to explain what your code does. They help make your code easier to read and understand. This can help you and others who read your code.

![code](https://i.stack.imgur.com/dMDMx.png)

## WHAT IS A *VARIABLE*?
### A script will have to temporarily store the bits of information it needs to do its job. It can store this data in variables. 

## **DATA TYPES**:
### 1. *NUMERIC DATA TYPE* The numeric data type handles numbers ,**0.75** For tasks that involve counting or calculating sums, you will use numbers 0-9.
### 2. *STRING DATA TYPE* The strings data type consists of letters and other characters. **'H.1' Ivy! 1** Note how the string data type is enclosed within a pair of quotes. 
### 3. *BOOLEAN DATA TYPE* Boolean data types can have one of two values: true or false. true It might seem a little abstract at first, but the Boolean data type is actually very helpful. 


## **Decisions and loops** :

### Decision making: there are often several places in a script where decisions are made that determine which lines of code should be run next , flowchart can help you plan for these plans .

# **Comparision operators** 
### Evaluating conditions:

**==** : is equal to , it compares two values to see if they are the same .

**!=** : is not equal to , it compares two values to see if they are not the same .

**===**: strict equal to , compares two values to check if they are both the data and value are the same 

**!==** : strict not equal to , compares two values to check if they are both the data and value are not the same.

**>**: greater than, checks if the number on the left is greater than the number on the right .

**<**: less than , checks if the number on the left is less than on the right .

**>=**: grater than or equal ,checks if the number on the left is greater or equal the number on the right .

**<=**: less than or equal , cheks if the number on the left is less or equal the number on the right.

**&&**: test more than one condition .

**||**: test at least one condition .

**!** : takes a single boolean value and inverts it.
